GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/skills.description: serves an array of all skills

GET /api/users/:username.description: serves an object for an user for the specified username

user.bio: Hi I'm Jason and I am a qualified roofer. Got a tile missing? Give me a shout!

POST /api/users.description: serves an object for the posted user

GET /api/jobs.description: serves an array of all jobs

jobs.title: Computer says no
jobs.body: Hi guys, I think I've got a virus on my computer. The screen has gone blank and is not responding, would anyone be able to give their opinion?

jobs.title: Tired of wallpaper bubbles - please help!
jobs.body: Hey guys, if anyone is free to help me with some wallpapering, I would be eternally grateful!

jobs.title: Hedge trimming help?
jobs.body: Hi all, I have a privet hedge that is out of control and is taking over the path. Would anyone be willing to help me tackle it?

jobs.title: Bought a new wireless headset for my macbook, but I cannot get it to connect - can anyone help please
jobs.body: Hey all, are they any macbook experts who may be able to pop round and help me set up a wireless headset. I need it for a zoom call next week. Thanks in advance!.

jobs.title: Computer won't turn on
jobs.body: Hi guys, my MacBook Air is refusing to turn itself on today. It's plugged into a charger and is only a few years old. If anyone who knows about these things would be able to give it a once over that would be tremendously helpful.

jobs.title: Lightbulb gone - and so has my back!
jobs.body: Hi all, I need a lightbulb changing but I have done my back in recently and can't do it. Can anyone help!

jobs.title: Dripping tap driving me mad - help!
jobs.body: Hi there, I've got a dripping tap if anyone has the tools to fix it! It's driving me nuts!

jobs.title: Flat pack fans?
jobs.body: Hi all, I have just moved house and went a bit made in Ikea. Would anyone have any spare time to lend a hand with the flat-pack?

jobs.title: Missing roof tile after the storm!
jobs.body: Hi all I noticed a tile had fallen off my roof. Would be very grateful if someone could take a look.

jobs.title: Cleaning help please
jobs.body: Hi guys, I have been visiting my dad in hospital the past few weeks and the cleaning has really got on top of me. I would so appreciate some help with that if possible. Happy to donate to a good cause too!

jobs.title: Anyone good at proofreading?
jobs.body: Hi all would anyone be willing to proofread the first draft of my phd. It needs a fresh pair of eyes! There's no massive rush just in the next month or so would be great.

jobs.title: Tax return hell!
jobs.body: Hi all, I am trying to do my first tax return and I'm a little lost. Would anyone with the relevant knowledge have an hour to spare to help me?

POST /api/jobs.description: serves an object for the posted job

GET /api/jobs/:job_id.description: serves a job object for the specified job_id

job.title: Hedge trimming help?
job.body: Hi all, I have a privet hedge that is out of control and is taking over the path. Would anyone be willing to help me tackle it?

DELETE /api/jobs/:job_id.description: deletes the given job by job id and responds with 204

POST /api/jobs/:job_id/comments.description: serves an object of the posted comment for the specified job_id

body.body: Congratulations to your daughter on graduating. I'm free on friday evenings

comment.body: Congratulations to your daughter on graduating. I'm free on friday evenings

GET /api/jobs/:job_id/comments.description: serves an array of comments for the specified article_id

comments.body: Hello, I can pop round tomorrow evening if that suits.
Hi there, I am happy to come and take a look. Bit tied up with work until next weekend though.

GET /api/comments?username.description: serves an array of comments for the specified username

comments.body: Hi there, sounds like it could be a battery issue. I am happy to come and take a look. I am free any evening this weekend.

Hiya I had a similiar issue with my MacBook Air - I had to buy a new battery in the end! But I know a thing or two about MacBooks so I could come round and do some troubleshooting. Saturday afternoon works for me!
Hello, I can pop round tomorrow evening if that suits.

GET /api/charities.description: serves an array of all charities

charities.charity_description: Age UK is the national charity dedicated to helping everyone make the most of later life. Ageing is not an illness, but it can be challenging. We help more than 7 million people every year, providing companionship, advice and support for older people who need it most.

Amnesty International UK is movement of ordinary people standing up for humanity and human rights. Some of our campaigns includes refugees, climate change, children's rights, women's rights, and conflict-affected countries. When we unite even the smallest acts of humanity make a difference.

Book Trust is the UK's largest reading charity, transforming lives by getting children and families reading. With your help, we can ensure that nobody misses out on the life-changing benefits that reading can bring.

We raise money to fund research to keep hearts beating and blood flowing. Our vision is a world without heart and circulatory conditions like heart diseases, stroke, vascular dementia and their risk factors like diabetes. Together, we can beat the heartbreak these conditions cause.
We are the world’s largest charity dedicated to saving lives through research. Our vision is to bring forward the day when all cancers are cured.

Cats Protection is the UK's leading feline welfare charity. We help around 200,000 cats and kittens every year through our network of 250 volunteer-run branches over 30 centres. We find homes for cats, promote the benefits of neutering and produce a wide range of cat care information for owners.

Centrepoint is the UK’s leading charity for homeless young people. Together with our partners we support over 15,000 16-25 year olds into a home and a job every year. Working directly in London and the north of England, our work covers all of the UK through a network of 40 partner organisations.

Dogs Trust is the largest dog welfare charity in the UK. We rescue and rehome dogs all over the UK (Ireland too). We never put a healthy dog down. We also promote responsible dog ownership through youth education, neutering and microchipping campaigns. A dog is for Life, not just for Christmas.
We find solutions to environmental problems to see a fair world for future generations.

Greenpeace Environmental Trust is the charitable arm of Greenpeace in the UK. It works closely with Greenpeace Ltd, the campaigning organisation, to protect our environment by funding education, scientific research and investigative projects in world ecology. All income raised from your sponsorships will go to Greenpeace Environmental Trust to enable us to claim Gift Aid on these donations (where appropriate).

We’re Mind, the mental health charity. We believe no one should have to face a mental health problem alone. We’re here for you. Today. Now. Whether you’re stressed, depressed or in crisis. We’ll listen, give support and advice, and fight your corner.

The state of men’s health is in a crisis. Simply put, men are dying too young. We seek to make a global contribution to men living happier, healthier, longer lives. This ambition underpins everything we do. It is the driving force behind our campaigns, funding strategy, and vision for the future.

Over 100,000 of us in the UK have MS. It’s unpredictable and different for everyone. But it doesn’t have to be this way. We’re the MS Society. We understand what life’s like with MS. We're here for you through the highs, lows and everything in between. Together, we are strong enough to stop MS.

We’re the only charity fighting to end child abuse in the UK and Channel Islands. That’s why we help children who’ve been abused to rebuild their lives, we protect children at risk, and we find the best ways of preventing child abuse from ever happening.

Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone.

Every day 250 people in the UK start losing their sight. With your help, we can be there when people need us most, support independent living, create an inclusive society and prevent avoidable sight loss. Every pound you raise will help create a future where sight loss is no longer a barrier.

RNLI volunteer lifeboat crews provide a 24-hour search and rescue service all around the UK and Ireland, while lifeguards keep a careful watch on the UK’s busiest beaches. RNLI lifesaving and drowning prevention depend on supporter fundraising and the generous donations that you and others give.
We rescue, rehabilitate and rehome animals to improve their welfare and lives.
Samaritans is available round the clock, every single day of the year providing a safe place for anyone struggling to cope, whoever they are, however they feel, whatever life has done to them.
We’re Scope and we want equality for disabled people. We provide practical and emotional information and support when it’s needed most and we campaign relentlessly to create a fairer society.
We’re Scope and we want equality for disabled people. We provide practical and emotional information and support when it’s needed most and we campaign relentlessly to create a fairer society.

Shelter works to alleviate the distress caused by homelessness and bad housing. We help people find and keep a home. We campaign for decent housing for all. Our work won’t stop until there’s a home for everyone.

Show Racism the Red Card is an anti-racism education charity which utilises the high profile of professional footballers as anti-racist role-models to combat racism in society. We produce educational resources and deliver training events and workshops.

Terrence Higgins Trust was one of the first charities to be set up in response to the HIV epidemic and has been at the forefront of the fight against HIV, and improving the nation's sexual health, ever since. THT offers services to people infected, or affected, by HIV and ill sexual health. We support over 85,000 people through counselling, advocacy, health education, one hour HIV testing and buddying. Over vision is a world where people with HIV live healthy lives free from prejudice and discrimination, and good sexual health is a right and reality for all.

Right now, millions of children are in danger. They face violence, disease, hunger and the chaos of war and disaster. Unicef ensures more children get life-saving food, vaccinations, education and protection than anyone else. With your help, we can build a safer world for children.

WaterAid is an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. Only by tackling these three essentials in ways that last can people change their lives for good.

We’re the world’s leading independent conservation organisation. And we’re building a future where people and nature thrive together. That’s why we’re passionate about sharing the planet’s resources more sustainably, tackling climate change and protecting endangered wildlife.
